meanings.sent1: We need to precool the drinks before the party.
meanings.sent2: I always precool the oven before baking cookies.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to precool the stove, but the cookies still burned!
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor seemed to precool the heated argument.
meanings.sent5: Remember to precool the soup to enhance its flavors.

meanings.sent1: The ice cream will precool in the freezer.
meanings.sent2: The room precooled as the air conditioner turned on.
meanings.sent3: The car's engine decided to precool itself on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: His attitude seemed to precool as he entered the chilly room.
meanings.sent5: The river precooled as the sun began to set.
